com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders

Class AbstractAttributesAndViewsBuilder<T extends AbstractAttributesAndViewsBuilder,U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.modules.entity.config.builders.AbstractAttributesAndViewsBuilder<T,U>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EntitiesConfigurationBuilder, EntityAssociationBuilder, EntityConfigurationBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractAttributesAndViewsBuilder<T extends AbstractAttributesAndViewsBuilder,U>
extends Object
    Base class for entity related builder supporting configuration of attributes and builder post processors. Most methods should be overridden in child builders to provide type specificity.
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme
    See Also:
    EntitiesConfigurationBuilder, EntityConfigurationBuilder, EntityAssociationBuilder

                       S value)
        Add a custom attribute this builder should apply to the entity it processes.

        Returns:

      • addPostProcessor

        public void addPostProcessor(PostProcessor<U> postProcessor)
        Add a post processor that will be applied to all configurations in the registry. The post processors will be applied after all other building operations are done.
        Parameters:
        postProcessor - Post processor instance to add.

      • view

        public abstract AbstractSimpleEntityViewBuilder view(String name)
        Returns a AbstractSimpleEntityViewBuilder instance for the view with the given name. If there is already another builder type for that view, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the view for which to retrieve a builder.
        Returns:
        builder instance

      • listView

        public abstract AbstractEntityListViewBuilder listView()
        Returns the default list view builder for the entity being configured. A default list view is usually available.
        Returns:
        builder instance

      • view

        public <V extends AbstractEntityViewBuilder<?,V>> V view(String name,
                                                         Class<V> builderClass)
        Returns a builder for the view with the specified name. Any existing builder is assumed to be of the given type and a new instance of that type will be created if there is no builder yet. Note that custom builder types *must* have a parameterless constructor.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Specific builder implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the view for which to retrieve a builder.
        builderClass - Type of the builder.
        Returns:
        builder instance
